sentence.Network_en: Far from being a dreamer, she's a level-headed pragmatist.
sentence.Network_cn: 她是个头脑冷静的务实派，绝不是一个不切实际的人。

sentence.Network_en: She was a fusion of the dreamer and doer.
sentence.Network_cn: 她是空想者和实干者的结合.

sentence.Network_en: Don't rely on his memory he's a bit of a dreamer.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要相信他的记忆力--他有点神不守舍的.

entry.tran: 梦想家;空想家;不切实际的人
entry.def: If you describe someone as a dreamer, you mean that they spend a lot of time thinking about and planning for things that they would like to happen but which are improbable or impractical.

example.ex: Far from being a dreamer, she's a level-headed pragmatist.
example.tran: 她是个头脑冷静的务实派,绝不是一个不切实际的人。

means.word_mean: 2. someone guided more by ideals than by practical considerations
3. a person who escapes into a world of fantasy

auth_sentence.content: I was, if nothing else, a modest dreamer.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was, if nothing else, a modest dreamer.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe I'm the dreamer in the relationship after all.

auth_sentence.content: Whatever his municipal legacy, Tony Wilson was always a far-sighted dreamer.

Sentence.sentence: When the dust settled, the space dreamers lost out.

The space dreamers end up benefiting all of us—not just because of the way they expand human knowledge, or because of the spin-off technologies they produce, but because the two types of dreams feed off each other
Tomorrow we will transcend these as well, and the dreamers will deserve a lot of the credit.
